item.title: Daily Podcast 2026-03-01
item.description: Coral reefs are often celebrated for their colorful fish and intricate structures, but beneath the surface lies an even more complex world: the microbial communities living inside and around corals. | The research team collected coral fragments and seawater samples from 99 reefs across 32 islands in the Pacific Ocean. | By combining this new data with publicly available coral and sponge microbiome datasets, the researchers built what they call the Reef Microbiome Database, or RMD.
item.itunes:author: Eva Dai
item.itunes:summary: Coral reefs are often celebrated for their colorful fish and intricate structures, but beneath the surface lies an even more complex world: the microbial communities living inside and around corals. | The research team collected coral fragments and seawater samples from 99 reefs across 32 islands in the Pacific Ocean. | By combining this new data with publicly available coral and sponge microbiome datasets, the researchers built what they call the Reef Microbiome Database, or RMD.
